biography:
Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs, often shortened to Pigs x7, is a British rock band known for its intense, high-energy performances and unique blend of psych-rock, stoner metal, and noise rock. Formed in Newcastle in 2012, the band includes Matt Baty on vocals, Sam Grant on guitar, Adam Ian Sykes on guitar, John-Michael Hedley on bass, and Ewan Mackenzie on drums.

Pigs x7 quickly gained a reputation for their thrillingly relentless live shows that are as much of an endurance test as they are a psychedelic trip. The band's gritty, feedback-laden sound pays homage to the heaviest of rock and roll traditions while also pushing boundaries with their eclectic influences and sprawling compositions.

The band released their debut album, "Feed The Rats", in 2017 to critical acclaim. This was followed by "King of Cowards" in 2018 and "Viscerals" in 2020, each further cementing the band's unique place in the pantheon of heavy music. The success of their records and their incendiary live performances have seen Pigs x7 grow from a cult favorite to a force to be reckoned with on the global stage.
name: Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs

lastfm.bio_summary: Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs, AKA Pigs x7, is an English rock band formed in Newcastle-upon-Tyne, United Kingdom in 2012. Their debut album, Feed the Rats, was released on United Kingdom label Rocket Recordings in 2017 to critical acclaim. The Guardian listed the band as one of their "top 40 newcomers" for 2018, and in 2018 their second album King of Cowards was released, described by The Guardian as "pulverizing but accessible metal". In April 2020 Read more on Last.fm
